messages.message:
> Are any generic user IDs required?  If yes, identify what functions they provide?
:point_up: FRB is doing security review and wants to know if Instabase requires any special accounts
what's an example of a generic user ID?
magic accounts like “system” or “customer-user” or anything that exists as a user in the system but isn’t controlled by SSO
like the old school `toor` accounts that used to show up on stock linux installs that caused all kinds of security issues

No. No such accounts are needed. Examples of Instabase accounts that FR will have:
[1] One of the FR employees will have an admin account on Instabase to set things up. This account will be controlled via SSO.
[2] a system account that will make API calls via Appian. They have already configured a system account via SSO.
